messages.subject: RE: [samuraihistory] Re: comic
messages.msgSnippet: ps.sorry for the RUN on sentences im just in a hurry No. If you are in too much of a hurry to write sentences correctly, then you are intoo much of a hurry
messages.messageBody:
"ps.sorry for the RUN on sentences im just in a hurry"


No.

If you are in too much of a hurry to write sentences correctly, then you
are intoo much of a hurry to do the research necessary. (THAT is assuming it
IS hurry and not laziness). This mailing list is not people to do your work
for you. It is for people who are interested in the history of the samurai
to share and compare thier research.
What have you contributed? Or if you are very young, what do you hope to
contribute when YOU know more.

M.J. Peters

messages.msgSnippet: u see i know a guy in defiance ohio in the US that i live bye and he needs ideas for a comic and im trying to help him his name is Dave Miller and thoughs of u
messages.messageBody:
u see i know a guy in defiance ohio in the US that i live bye and he
needs ideas for a comic and im trying to help him

his name is Dave Miller and thoughs of u that dont know who he is he
does some drawings for dc comics. i made a deal with him if i find some
posible ideas for drawings i could write the storys. but i wanted to
base it upon actual events and battles thats y i been askin i need many
ideas from u that i can use in the creation of this series

ps.sorry for the RUN on sentences im just in a hurry

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] comic
messages.msgSnippet: ... Although comics are principally considered a visual medium, there *is* text. May I suggest you put off doing a comic until you can learn to use
messages.messageBody:
jonboy_2233 wrote:
>
>
> i want u all to know that i am going to make one in the US with the
> same graphics such as the marvel kingdom come series with great
> graphics and inking that it will be almost as great as the kingdom come
> series thats what i mean when i talk about a comic series that is
> better than others
>
> PS:if u have any ideas or charaters for the series or even battle
> tactics email me at jonboy_2233@... <mailto:jonboy_2233%40yahoo.com>


Although comics are principally considered a visual medium,
there *is* text.

May I suggest you put off doing a comic until you can learn
to use punctuation, capitalization, syntax, and grammar
properly, and NOT to write one lone run-on sentence?



Tony
--

Anthony J. Bryant
Website: http://www.sengokudaimyo.com

Effingham's Heraldic Avatars (...and stuff):
http://www.sengokudaimyo.com/avatarbiz.html

All sorts of cool things Japanese and SCA:
http://www.cafepress.com/sengokudaimyo

messages.subject: Re: comic
messages.msgSnippet: ... Good luck. Alex Ross is considered by many to be the top painter/illustrator in Western comics today. If you put, say, twenty years into studying and
messages.messageBody:
--- In samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com, "jonboy_2233" <jonboy_2233@...> wrote:
>
> i want u all to know that i am going to make one in the US with the
> same graphics such as the marvel kingdom come series with great
> graphics and inking that it will be almost as great as the kingdom come
> series thats what i mean when i talk about a comic series that is
> better than others
>
>
>
> PS:if u have any ideas or charaters for the series or even battle
> tactics email me at jonboy_2233@...
>
Good luck. Alex Ross is considered by many to be the top painter/illustrator in Western comics today. If you put, say, twenty years into studying and practicing drawing, who knows what could happen?
By the way, the series Kingdom Come is produced by DC Comics (home of Superman and Batman), not Marvel.

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] comic
messages.msgSnippet: Jonboy - You have set yourself an admirable goal. Just plain history is too often overlooked in film and other media. However if you are open to suggestion I
messages.messageBody:
Jonboy -
You have set yourself an admirable goal. Just plain history is too
often overlooked in film and other media. However if you are open to
suggestion I wouldn't use Marvel comics as your model. I would look
to Frank Miller or his inspiration; Koike Kazuo.
MHO
-t
(also a big fan of Yokoyama Mitsuteru...)
